creator: robert.strong.bugs@gmail.com
summary: Change app.update.promptWaitTime preference to 8 days on the release (includes beta) and aurora channels

assigned_to_detail.name: robert.strong.bugs@gmail.com
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Robert Strong [:rstrong] (use needinfo to contact me)

comments.text:
The current value is 2 days.

This bug will make it so the update dialog asking the user to restart to apply an update is displayed after 8 days. 8 days was chosen since some users keep their browser open all week and restart over the weekend and this will make it so those users don't see the dialog.

All that needs to change to fix this bug is to change app.update.promptWaitTime to 691200 and the comment above that line to specify 184 hours in the following file
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/branding/official/pref/firefox-branding.js#14
comments.author: robert.strong.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text:
Benjamin, should the nightly and aurora channels (beta uses the same as release) be changed as well and if so to what value?

nightly = 12 hours
aurora = 168 hours

I think it would be a good thing to change aurora to 184 hours for consistency with release.
comments.author: robert.strong.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text: dveditz, heads up that dcamp and others have asked to show the update dialog to restart appear less often and 8 days has been decided on. There is already the client code to specify a shorter interval in the update.xml to ask the user to restart so if there is a critical exploit the update dialog to restart can be displayed much sooner.
comments.author: robert.strong.bugs@gmail.com

comments.text: bhearsum nthomas, heads up and could either of you confirm that balrog has support for specifying a different interval to display the restart update dialog via promptWaitTime in the update.xml?

It's just the comment, thus no real impact whatsoever except when reading the pref's description.
